TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content:
The thread title means, approximately, "The the way things were before the comic (narration)." Note that I'm not some kind of Latin expert, just a fan with a computer. Today's trope: Reset button

Cicero certissime dixisset "Quam latine!" Although for you, shouldn't it be more like "Status Q"?
Will you make more kerbfleet stories?

The Dres thing is from the 'Dres Awareness Challenge' thread that SpaceplaneAddict started.

We demand Dres love!

I vote Jool. Lotsa stuff to do.

And plenty of things that can go wrong.

Dres? Like that ficwriter kerbal? Or the one wich name noone remembers?

Or that wise one fron the deactivated mun post? Or the twins?

Dres. Elisium of the underated kerbs! Starring Bob kerman as Bob kerman, and Jebedian kerman as matt damon

Status Quo and Narratum means the accepted thing before the story. AM, ante meridium.

Source: inquo Latine (sed male)

Hum, now that you talk about this, how do the female kerbals put their hair like that? It is not like their hands reach the back of their heads ... Do they have special coiffeur officers to do the female kerbonauts hair ?

Yeah, I found myself wondering the same. Well, human men and women don't typically cut their own hair... I suppose it's just a step from there to having someone else comb or tie it. Hey, that's why kerbals cooperate so well! It's evolutionarily driven! Woo hoo!

The thread title means, approximately, "The the way things were before the comic (narration)." Note that I'm not some kind of Latin expert, just a fan with a computer. Today's trope: Reset button

Right, I was going for something along the lines of 'status quo ante bellum' (basic diplomatic for "let's just go back to the way it was before the war,k?") And i picked the masculine 'narratus' rather than the feminine 'fabula' so that the declension would work out the same. not that I'm any kind of a latin expert either.

Will you make more kerbfleet stories?

Yes. Will you keep reading them?

Dres? Like that ficwriter kerbal? Or the one wich name noone remembers?

Or that wise one fron the deactivated mun post? Or the twins?

Dres. Elisium of the underated kerbs! Starring Bob kerman as Bob kerman, and Jebedian kerman as matt damon

Come to think of it, Dres the B-planet might be the perfect mission for the B-team. Hm..

Might interest some of you that I started a thread to capture all the Kerbfleet canon that's been accumulating. Feel free to contribute/remind me of things that should be added and I will update the OP as I'm able.

On E:O0 I do have a few pages done, but this sequence probably needs to be posted all at once--so, you'll have to wait, but when the waiting is done you will have all of Chapter 10 to look at (and the end of the book, excepting the Postlude.)

Sorry I've been away from here for a while, just got caught up on the whole story.

Excellent work Kuzzter! Very entertaining, and with all those charges, normally somebody would be put in a hole and forgotten for the next 200 years.

Glad it all worked out for our courageous Kerbals.
Just putting it out there, the Joolian system looks nice at this time of year. Lots of small and large moons. If based on Laythe, don't forget your SSTO's and ISRU units!
Yes, with the update there is lots of fun ahead around Jool... Land a floating runway perhaps... Take Mort to a journey around Dres, maybe he likes to stay...
Jool and its moons look good for a destination. Especially with extensive ISRU experience, and the small jet engines Kerbin's engineers have just turned out

Huzzah for our heroes! To answer a previous question; yes, I will keep reading your stories. You (and Parkaboy) have added a nice element to the game & have made it even more enjoyable. I can no longer fly an approach into KSC without noting my altitude above Mount Whoopstooshort!

Thank you & well done!
Eeloo for christmas?
I say go Dres Awareness!

I say go Dres Awareness!

My whining has once again brought change
It's been an honor and a pleasure, folks. Lots of little things squeezed in these last few pages; hope you enjoy
*applause*
Wow.exe

Awesome job Kuz!

Danny

Good ending to the story. Might I suggest the next part of the mission be focused on filing up the Science Libraries? You've filled the tech tree, now fill the science library! Get a report from every body or something. Something!

le-ding

Rofl.

And that's it. Until Kuzzter feels like starting all over, that's the end. Kerbfleet has been milked for all of it's worth across this plot-line, by Mort for money and Kuzzter for a truly inspiring story. This is truly Kuzzter's Magnum Opus, and he would have to be a god to do anything better than this. I don't know the quality of his next thing, I don't know what it's coming out, but I can assume that it will be at least a slight downgrade after beginning his run with a bang, and it won't be out for a long time. Good Job, Kuzzter. Good Job, Kerbals. Let's all have a hydrazine toast, and know that this is the best thing ever. Cheers! This is The Raincrafter, and that is my opinion on the recent events of the comic's universe.
Ad astra!

DRES TIME!!!

Hopefully
All good things come to an end... but wow, what a nice story. Thanks for making a really entertaining read.
